defy.英释: to refuse to obey a law or rule, or refuse to do what someone in authority tells you to do

tank.英释: a large container for storing liquid or gas

rape.英释: the crime of forcing someone to have sex, especially by using violence

vary.英释: if something varies, it changes depending on the situation

deny.英释: to say that something is not true, or that you do not believe something

dare.英释: to be brave enough to do something that is risky or that you are afraid to do – used especially in questions or negative sentences

trim.英释: to make something look neater by cutting small pieces off it

ruin.英释: to spoil or destroy something completely

lawn.英释: an area of ground in a garden or park that is covered with short grass

crew.英释: all the people who work on a ship or plane

code.英释: a system of words, letters, or symbols that you use instead of ordinary writing, so that the information can only be understood by someone else who knows the system

mall.英释: a large area where there are a lot of shops, usually a covered area where cars are not allowed

grip.英释: the way you hold something tightly, or your ability to do this

spot.英释: to notice someone or something, especially when they are difficult to see or recognize

jury.英释: a group of 12 ordinary people who listen to the details of a case in court and decide whether someone is guilty or not

trap.英释: to catch an animal or bird using a trap

keen.英释: someone with a keen mind is quick to understand things

shed.英释: To shed blood means to kill people in a violent way. If someone sheds their blood, they are killed in a violent way, usually when they are fighting in a war.

fuss.英释: anxious behaviour or activity that is usually about unimportant things

buck.英释: a US, Canadian, or Australian dollar

view.英释: to think about something or someone in a particular way

host.英释: to provide the place and everything that is needed for an organized event

fake.英释: a copy of a valuable object, painting etc that is intended to deceive people

plot.英释: the events that form the main story of a book, film, or play

mask.英释: to hide your feelings or the truth about a situation

edit.英释: to prepare a book, piece of film etc for printing or broadcasting by removing mistakes or parts that are not acceptable

flee.英释: to leave somewhere very quickly, in order to escape from danger

clue.英释: an object or piece of information that helps someone solve a crime or mystery

cozy.英释: a place that is cozy is small, comfortable, and warm

melt.英释: if something solid melts or if heat melts it, it becomes liquid

lest.英释: in order to make sure that something will not happen

bias.英释: an opinion about whether a person, group, or idea is good or bad that influences how you deal with it

echo.英释: if a sound echoes, you hear it again because it was made near something such as a wall or hill

chew.英释: to bite food several times before swallowing it

hurl.英释: to throw something with a lot of force, especially because you are angry

skip.英释: to not read, mention, or deal with something that would normally come or happen next

gown.英释: a long loose piece of clothing worn for special ceremonies by judges, teachers, lawyers, and members of universities

rate.英释: a charge or payment that is set according to a standard scale

boom.英释: a quick increase of business activity

peer.英释: your peers are the people who are the same age as you, or who have the same type of job, social class etc

soar.英释: to fly, especially very high up in the sky, floating on air currents

flat.英释: a place for people to live that consists of a set of rooms that are part of a larger building

bump.英释: to move up and down as you move forward, especially in a vehicle

pave.英释: to cover a path, road, area etc with a hard level surface such as blocks of stone or concrete

flaw.英释: a mistake, mark, or weakness that makes something imperfect

deem.英释: to think of something in a particular way or as having a particular quality

lack.英释: to not have something that you need, or not have enough of it

slim.英释: someone who is slim is attractively thin

rank.英释: to arrange objects in a line or row

urge.英释: to strongly suggest that someone does something

jail.英释: a place where criminals are kept as part of their punishment, or where people who have been charged with a crime are kept before they are judged in a law court

sway.英释: to influence someone so that they change their opinion

pose.英释: to exist in a way that may cause a problem, danger, difficulty etc

rare.英释: not seen or found very often, or not happening very often

curb.英释: to control or limit something in order to prevent it from having a harmful effect

poll.英释: the process of finding out what people think about something by asking many people the same question, or the record of the result

odds.英释: how likely it is that something will or will not happen

hack.英释: to secretly find a way of getting information from someone else’s computer or changing information on it

memo.英释: a short official note to another person in the same company or organization

reap.英释: to cut and collect a crop of grain

fade.英释: to lose colour and brightness, or to make something do this

deal.英释: to buy and sell illegal drugs

hike.英释: to take a long walk in the mountains or countryside

damn.英释: If you say that a person or a news report damns something such as a policy or action, you mean that they are very critical of it

main.英释: a large pipe or wire carrying the public supply of water, electricity, or gas

nest.英释: to build or use a nest

coin.英释: to make pieces of money from metal

axis.英释: the imaginary line around which a large round object, such as the Earth, turns

sign.英释: an event, fact etc that shows that something is happening or that something is true or exists

gust.英释: a short, strong, sudden rush of wind

hose.中释: 软管；袜类（包括连裤袜、长筒袜、短袜）
hose.英释: a long rubber or plastic tube that can be moved and bent to put water onto fires, gardens etc

sofa.英释: a comfortable seat with raised arms and a back, that is wide enough for two or three people to sit on

glue.英释: to join two things together using glue

wink.英释: to close and open one eye quickly to communicate something or show that something is a secret or joke

mint.英释: a place where coins are officially made

hymn.英释: a song of praise to God

fore.中释: 在（或向）船头；在（或向）飞行器头部
fore.英释: at or towards the front of a ship or an aircraft

roam.英释: to walk or travel, usually for a long time, with no clear purpose or direction

dome.英释: a round roof on a building

bead.英释: a small piece of glass, wood, etc. with a hole through it, that can be put on a string with others of the same type and worn as jewellery, etc.

head.英释: to hit the ball with your head, especially in football

hook.英释: to fasten or hang sth on sth else using a hook; to be fastened or hanging in this way

diet.英释: the kind of food that a person or animal eats each day

cite.中释: 引证；引用；〔法院〕传召，传讯
cite.英释: to mention something as an example, especially one that supports, proves, or explains an idea or situation

veil.英释: to cover something with a veil

chop.英释: a small piece of meat on a bone, usually cut from a sheep or pig

baby.英释: a younger child in a family, often the youngest

fort.英释: a strong building or group of buildings used by soldiers or an army for defending an important place

wind.英释: moving air, especially when it moves strongly or quickly in a current

jean.英释: a tough twill-weave cotton fabric used for hard-wearing trousers, overalls, etc

evil.英释: something that is very bad or harmful

team.英释: to put two things or people together, because they will look good or work well together

hail.英释: to call to someone in order to greet them or try to attract their attention

nice.英释: involving a very small difference or detail

germ.英释: a very small living thing that can make you ill

lace.英释: to fasten something by tying a lace

tape.英释: to fasten a package, box etc with sticky tape

body.英释: 英文释义 an object that is separate from other objects

mast.英释: a tall pole on which the sails or flags on a ship are hung

atom.英释: the smallest part of an element that can exist alone or can combine with other substances to form a molecule

mesh.英释: material made from threads or wires that have been woven together like a net, or a piece of this material

hull.英释: the outer covering of seeds, rice, grain etc

tile.英释: a flat square piece of baked clay or other material, used for covering walls, floors etc

watt.英释: a unit for measuring electrical power

haul.英释: to pull something heavy with a continuous steady movement

nose.英释: the front part of a plane, boat , etc

bald.英释: having little or no hair on your head

even.英释: not changing very much in amount, speed, etc.

bore.英释: someone who is boring, especially because they talk too much about themselves or about things that do not interest you

wade.英释: to walk through water that is not deep

moss.英释: a very small green plant that grows in a thick soft furry mass on wet soil, trees, or rocks

hurt.英释: a feeling of great unhappiness because someone, especially someone you trust, has treated you badly or unfairly

rear.英释: to look after a person or animal until they are fully grown

hiss.英释: to make a noise which sounds like ‘ssss’

harp.英释: a large musical instrument with strings that are stretched across a vertical frame with three corners, and that you play with your fingers

oath.英释: a formal and very serious promise

snob.英释: someone who thinks they are better than people from a lower social class – used to show disapproval

moor.英释: to fasten a ship or boat to the land or to the bottom of the sea using ropes or an anchor

suit.英释: to be acceptable, suitable, or convenient for a particular person or in a particular situation

hide.英释: an animal’s skin, especially when it has been removed to be used for leather

maid.英释: a woman or girl who is not married

ware.英释: objects made of the material or in the way or place mentioned

sift.英释: to put flour, sugar etc through a sieve or similar container in order to remove large pieces

tone.英释: one of the many types of a particular colour, each slightly darker, lighter, brighter etc than the next

scan.英释: a medical test in which a special machine produces a picture of something inside your body

mute.英释: a small piece of metal, rubber etc that you place over or into a musical instrument to make it sound softer

late.英释: used about someone who has died fairly recently

plea.英释: a request that is urgent or full of emotion

rash.英释: (of people or their actions) doing sth that may not be sensible without first thinking about the possible results; done in this way

slit.英释: a long straight narrow cut or hole

visa.英释: an official mark put on your passport that gives you permission to temporarily enter or leave a foreign country

pant.英释: to breathe quickly with short noisy breaths, for example because you have been running or because it is very hot

jack.英释: a piece of equipment used to lift a heavy weight off the ground, such as a car, and support it while it is in the air

tack.英释: to attach something to a wall, board etc, using a tack

cape.英释: a long loose piece of clothing without sleeves that fastens around your neck and hangs from your shoulders

foam.英释: a type of soft rubber with a lot of air in it, used in furniture

limp.英释: a way of walking in which one leg is used less than normal because it is injured or stiff

clap.英释: the loud sound that you make when you hit your hands together many times to show that you enjoyed something

mess.英释: to make something look untidy or dirty

feel.英释: to have a particular physical quality which you become aware of by touching

doom.英释: to make someone or something certain to fail, die, be destroyed etc

jerk.英释: to pull something suddenly and roughly

ally.英释: a country that agrees to help or support another country in a war

pore.英释: one of the small holes in your skin that liquid, especially sweat, can pass through, or a similar hole in the surface of a plant

vine.英释: a plant with long thin stems that attach themselves to other plants, trees, buildings etc

bull.英释: someone who buys shares because they expect prices to rise

oval.英释: a shape like a circle, but wider in one direction than the other

prey.英释: (of an animal or a bird) to hunt and kill another animal for food

dust.英释: dry powder consisting of extremely small bits of dirt that is in buildings on furniture, floors etc if they are not kept clean

void.英释: (of a contract, an agreement etc.) not valid or legal

reel.英释: to wind sth on/off a reel

vein.英释: one of the tubes which carries blood to your heart from other parts of your body

tuna.英释: a large sea fish caught for food

horn.英释: a hollow curved object that is narrow at one end and wide at the other

reef.英释: a line of sharp rocks, often made of coral, or a raised area of sand near the surface of the sea

coke.英释: a solid black substance produced from coal and burned to provide heat

clip.英释: to cut small amounts of something in order to make it tidier

sham.英释: to pretend to be upset, ill etc to gain sympathy or an advantage

fowl.英释: a bird, such as a chicken, that is kept for its meat and eggs, or the meat of this type of bird

line.英释: to sew a piece of material onto the inside or back of another piece to make it stronger or warmer

tact.英释: the ability to be careful about what you say or do, so that you do not upset or embarrass other people

Mars.英释: the small red planet that is fourth in order from the Sun and is nearest the Earth

wasp.英释: a thin black and yellow flying insect that can sting you

monk.英释: a member of an all-male religious group that lives apart from other people in a monastery

howl.英释: a loud cry or shout showing pain, anger, unhappiness etc

move.英释: something that you decide to do in order to achieve something

pest.英释: a small animal or insect that destroys crops or food supplies

peel.英释: the skin of some fruits and vegetables, especially the thick skin of fruits such as oranges, which you do not eat

slap.英释: a quick hit with the flat part of your hand

pipe.英释: a musical instrument in the shape of a tube, played by blowing

arch.英释: to form or make something form a curved shape

duke.英释: a nobleman of the highest rank

dove.英释: a kind of small white pigeon often used as a sign of peace

mend.英释: to repair sth that has been damaged or broken so that it can be used again

veto.英释: a refusal to give official permission for something, or the right to refuse to give such permission

seam.英释: a line where two pieces of cloth, leather etc have been stitched together

herd.英释: to bring people together in a large group, especially roughly

toss.英释: to keep changing your position in bed because you cannot sleep

beam.英释: to send out a line of light, heat, energy etc

bait.英释: food used to attract fish, animals, or birds so that you can catch them

yoke.英释: a wooden bar used for keeping two animals together, especially cattle, when they are pulling heavy loads

stew.英释: a hot meal made by cooking meat and vegetables slowly in liquid for a long time

solo.英释: a piece of music for one performer

yolk.英释: the yellow part in the centre of an egg

fill.英释: to perform a particular job, activity, or purpose in an organization, or to find someone or something to do this

butt.英释: a large round container for collecting or storing liquids

stem.英释: the part of a word that stays the same when different endings are added to it, for example ‘driv-’ in ‘driving’

poke.英释: to quickly push your finger or some other pointed object into something or someone

puff.英释: to breathe quickly and with difficulty after the effort of running, carrying something heavy etc

gear.英释: machinery in a vehicle that turns engine power (or power on a bicycle) into movement forwards or backwards

muse.英释: to think about something for a long time

hush.英释: used to tell people to be quiet, or to comfort a child who is crying or upset

mock.英释: to laugh at someone or something and try to make them look stupid by saying unkind things about them or by copying them

toad.英释: a small animal that looks like a large frog and lives mostly on land

herb.英释: a small plant that is used to improve the taste of food, or to make medicine

rule.英释: to make an official decision about something, especially a legal problem

ward.英释: a large room in a hospital where people who need medical treatment stay

norm.英释: the usual or normal situation, way of doing something etc

fall.英释: to pass into a particular state; to begin to be sth

fuse.英释: a short thin piece of wire inside electrical equipment which prevents damage by melting and stopping the electricity when there is too much power

chip.英释: a small piece of wood, stone, metal etc that has been broken off something

scar.英释: a permanent mark that is left on your skin after you have had a cut or wound

lily.英释: one of several types of plant with large bell-shaped flowers of various colours, especially white

bank.英释: to put or keep money in a bank

dock.英释: if a ship docks, or if the captain docks it, it sails into a dock so that it can unload

alas.英释: used to express sadness, shame, or fear

peak.英释: a part that forms a point above a surface or at the top of something

cane.英释: thin pieces of the stems of plants, used for making furniture and baskets

lump.英释: to collect into a mass or group

span.英释: the part of a bridge, arch etc that goes across from one support to another

pier.英释: a structure that is built over and into the water so that boats can stop next to it or people can walk along it

pace.英释: to walk first in one direction and then in another many times, especially because you are nervous

pope.英释: the leader of the Roman Catholic Church

axle.英释: the bar connecting two wheels on a car or other vehicle

buzz.英释: to make a continuous sound, like the sound of a bee

dean.英释: someone in a university who is responsible for a particular area of work

sink.英释: a large open container that you fill with water and use for washing yourself, washing dishes etc

fret.英释: to worry about something, especially when there is no need

tilt.英释: to move, or make sth move, into a position with one side or end higher than the other

grab.英释: to take hold of someone or something with a sudden or violent movement

riot.英释: (of a crowd of people) to behave in a violent way in a public place, often as a protest

peck.英释: (of birds) to move the beak forward quickly and hit or bite sth

trot.英释: the movement of a horse at trotting speed

flap.英释: the noisy movement of something such as cloth in the air
